text: Usta Murad Mosque (), was a Tunisian mosque located in the medina of Tunis. It does not exist anymore.Mohamed Belkhodja, Tārīkh maʻālim al-tawḥīd fī al-qadīm wa-fī al-Jadīd, Tunis, al-Maṭbaʻah al-Tūnisīyah, 1939, 429 p == Localization== The mosque was located in El Hokam Street (). == Etymology== It got its name from its founder, the Muradid Dey Usta Murad who founded the Ghar el Melh harbor Porto Farina.Paul Sebag, Tunis au XVIIe siècle : une cité barbaresque au temps de la course, Paris, L'Harmattan, 1989, 267 p. (, lire en ligne [archive]), p. 98-99 == History== The mosque was built between 1637 and 1640, which was the Usta Murad's reign period. == References == Category:Mosques in Tunis Category:17th-century mosques
title: Usta Murad Mosque
